title: Peace Corps Kenya
description: Served as a STEM Education Teacher in rural Kenya, leading community development projects and teaching Math/Physics.
longDescription:
As a STEM Education Teacher in Kakamega county, Kenya, I combined engineering practice with global development (Humanitarian Engineering). I taught Math and Physics to students in rural areas, adapting to extremely limited resources.

Key Achievements & Projects:
• Established a Science and Engineering Club to encourage critical thinking and practical skill-building.
• Utilized school projectors and mobile phones to bolster instruction and led meetings with fellow teachers on technology literacy.
• Led community projects involving grant writing, developing a demonstration garden, and implementing a pumped potable water system.
• Acquired intermediate Swahili language skills and advanced classroom management techniques.

title: Keep The Beep
description: Designed a ruggedized soft housing for GE Carescape physiological monitors to prevent damage during high-pressure patient transport.
longDescription:
For my Capstone Design project, I worked with Emory University Hospital to solve a critical issue: GE Carescape B450 physiological monitors were being damaged during patient transport. The solution was 'Keep The Beep', a ruggedized soft housing.

Technical Approach:
• Designed a soft, chemically inert, and easily sanitized protective housing.
• Utilized a FaroArm Quantum 3D Scanner to import monitor geometry into SolidWorks and Fusion360.
• Rapidly prototyped the design using 3D printing with soft TPU filament for the impact-absorbing body and PLA for rigid connection points.

title: Sanitation Infrastructure
description: Led the design and implementation of sanitation latrines and handwashing stations for Mpitilira primary school in Malawi.
longDescription:
Serving as Technical Lead (2021-2022) and Project Lead (2022) for Engineers Without Borders (EWB-GT), I managed the implementation of sanitation infrastructure for a school in Eastern Malawi.

Project Details:
• Designed ventilated double pit latrine blocks and handwashing stations to improve sanitation for students.
• Conducted rigorous needs assessments and design iterations using decision matrices and community feedback.
• Coordinated with partners like Bless Bay Foundation and Freshwater Project International.
• Successfully managed the sanitation upgrade fully remotely during the COVID-19 pandemic constraints.

title: Personal Robotics
description: A collection of mechatronics projects including a 3D-printed quadruped robot and a self-balancing robot.
longDescription:
A portfolio of personal robotics projects demonstrating skills in mechatronics and control theory.

1. Micro-Spot Quadruped:
• A fully 3D-printed quadruped robot powered by 12 servo actuators and an ESP32 microcontroller.
• Developed custom inverse kinematic code and algorithms to control limb movements.

2. Two-Wheel Balancing Robot:
• Built using parts sourced entirely from local online vendors in rural Western Kenya.
• Implements a PID controller on an ESP32 with an MPU6050 gyroscope for active balancing.

title: VAMPIRE Research
description: Conducted research on building heat loss using drone-based thermal imaging and sensor networks.
longDescription:
VAMPIRE (Fast Radiative Heat Analysis) is a research initiative aimed at estimating radiative heat loss from structures in the built environment.

Technical Contributions:
• Utilized drones equipped with thermal cameras and surface-from-motion photogrammetry to capture building thermal profiles.
• Designed and implemented custom numerical surface integration software to process thermal OBJ files and calculate heat loss metrics.
